intro: Erechthites haplogyna, commonly known as the common blueweed, is an annual flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its blue to purple flowers bloom in the summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Erechthites haplogyna is often found in disturbed soils, along roadsides, and in open fields.
